column2: pash, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: THIS medication is very effective and works within a day of use. My appetite has increased a lot since taking the medication but I am overall satisfied

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I just wanted to let everyone know that the metallic taste is easily dealt with:Eat a small amount of pineapple or ginger.Canned pineapple, frozen pineapple, pineapple smoothies, pickled sushi ginger, sugar candied ginger, even just touching a tiny amount of the ginger root to your tongue; all work very quickly to remove the taste.

column2: Susan, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My doctor gave me this to clear up an infection. While it worked for the infectio, it also caused a severe metallic taste in my mouth accomponied by severe heartburn, nausea and flu-like symptoms. At this point it has been 4 days since my last dose and the effects are still severe. Not worth the discomfort to me.

column2: 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: I'm one of those people that will be nervous to take a new medication and will worry about the potentially harmful side effects, and reading the reviews on Tindamax didn't help much! But I had an embarassing case of BV that was causing odor and I was desperate to get rid of it.  My doctor gave me the 2 day dose and I took all 4 pills at once right after dinner each day.  I had ZERO side effects, no metallic taste, no headaches, nausea, etc.  And by the next morning after taking the first dose my symptoms were almost gone. By the second day, completely gone!  I know everyone is different as far as how they react.  But I personally couldn't have had a more positive experience.  I would highly recommend it wouldn't hesitate to take it again.

column2: dl1216, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: On second day of taking one 500mg tablet 4x's/day for two days.  Feeling much better and symptoms have decreased dramatically. Haven't noticed any side effects. Just a little inconvenient taking with food and so many times throughout the day.  Very much worth taking though.

column2: Greatful, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed four 500mg at one time for Trichomoniasis (Trich).  The worst thing about it for me was the awful metallic taste it left in my mouth.  I took them right after dinner and before bed, slept like a baby and feel great.  It seemed to clear up my problem and I actually woke up the next morning feeling well rested.  I rate this prescription VERY EFFECTIVE and I am Satisfied...Unlike some of these post I have read, but different strokes for different folks.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After reading the negative experiences some reviewers reported, I was worried about taking the 2 day, 1,000mg course of treatment my doctor prescribed.  I am allergic to some meds and tend to get nauseous and feel poorly while in most meds.   I had absolutely no side effects from this med and it totally clear up my most uncomfortable infection.  So glad I took it!

column2: tk, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: believe this caused a SEIZURE...my dr prescribed while i had a yeast infection..even though you are NOT supposed to prescribe in those circumstances.  also taking prednisone at the same time so the question is whether the TINDAMX caused the seizure (happened the same nite i stated it) OR whether the combo of TINDAMAX and PREDNISONE created this monster.  I am REALLY unhappy w/ my dr... i told him 4x that i had yeast also..even opened my mouth to show him the thrush that was there and he still prescribed ...and really wants to know NOTHING about what happened ..............

column2: candyred, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: it broke me out

column2: uncomfortable, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a pap come back irregular so had to go for a colposcopy for a biopsy. A few days later I received a call from my obgyn that I had a bacterial infection which has nothing to do with the pap, so they prescribed tindamax, 2 500mg in the morning a 2 500 mg at night for two days, I never took 2000 mg of anything in a day. I finished them last night. I feel so wiped out and exhausted not sure if it worked or not because I am still feel like I have cramps. Haven't got my results yet from the biopsy. This really stinks feeling this way with this hot weather!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Doctor prescribed Tindamax for BV. Read a lot of bad reviews prior to taking the drug but tried it anyway. I've been taking 1000mg a day (2 500mg pills at once). I haven't experienced any side effects except slight dry mouth / metallic taste but not unbearable and definitely worth it since I am already feeling better. Just thought I'd add according to studies on the drug, only 13% of patients had any side effects. Which means 77% will experience no side effects. Don't let these reviews scare you; I feel perfectly fine, even better than I did before taking the drug. Also, I took the pills right after eating a full meal, so that could have a lot to do with why I did not feel any symptoms.

column2: Problem Solved, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with the BV by obgyn.  I was given this medication - 2 tabs of 500 once per day for 5 days.  Aside from a horrible taste in my mouth and coated tongue feeling that lasted for a few hours after taking the medication, I am quite pleased.  It started working within a day and a half, absolutely no side effects other than the one mentioned.  Would take it again if needed.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
MsM513, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication left a weird taste in my mouth the first couple days (2x/5days); but soon cleared up. My appetite increased while taking this drug.  It appears to have remedied the problem.

column2: Miss T, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is my second time taking tindamax and it dosent work or get rid of the BV that I have.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Leaves a bad taste that lingers.  Didn't clear up the infection, though helped somewhat.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: One complaint, causes dry mouth. I drink water all day long, but water could even change the taste or dryness of my mouth. Thank god I only had to take it for two days.

column2: sherrycanary, 65-74 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been off of Tindamax for over 2 weeks. I still have bitter taste in my mouth, dizziness, fatigue, and now have symptoms of BV, Before Tindamax I was asymptomatic, but took it because my OB/GYN prescribed it.

column2: Herewegoagain, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed 500mg twice a day for 14 days. I have recurrent BV that has plagued me for years. This dosage did get rid of the BV but gave me a HORRIBLE yeast infection that no OTC medicine could get rid of completely. My doctor described it as a "raging" infection...just to give you an idea. And I do not get yeast infections. I am again on Tindamax, same dose, and this time my doctor gave me Diflucan oral to take every 3 days along with the Tindamax. I am on day 5 and so far, so good.Side effects I'm getting are dry mouth and a slightly lightheaded feeling. Also, I found an OTC product that helps balance female pH that seemed to help- it's called RePhresh. If I hadn't already had a yeast infection, I'd try using RePhresh with the Tindamax next time.

column2: Mercy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took 2g and started passins dark green stool, feeling nausea,and shortness of breath. I wouldn't want to take it ever again.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My experience has been good using tindamax. Its not a long treament and very mild to my stomach. It took 4mths before i had to repeat the dose compared to flagyl.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed 500mg twice daily for five days. Im on the 4th day and have been vomiting and have been left with a terrible taste in my mouth.  Experiencing flu-like symptoms and unable to eat. Though it seems to have cleared the infection I am afraid to take the rest of the medicine.

column2: Vesy, Jupitertwo, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Took medication for BV.  1st dose of 500 mg. at 9pm.  Had lots of vivid dreams, noticed numbness of tongue within 2 hours.  Then took send dose of 500 mg. at 9am.  I was not myself.  I experienced severe dizziness/feeling of spinning (vertigo), unsteadiness, nauseous, clammy, headach, and higher blood pressure than usual.  I took my sugar level, it was fine.  My blood pressue is usually between 69-72, it was 89.  I seem to have difficulty consentrating. I ate as direct and continued to eat throughout the morning hoping to relieve the side-effect.  I will not continue this medication.  I am a healthy 42 year old, 5'4", 150 lbs., with no history of allegies.  I do not recommend this medication.

column2: Myoung, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took Tindamax 4 tablets all at once for 2 days.  I cannot describe the yeast infection it has caused.  Like a previous reviewer has said, it created a yeast infection like no other.  I doubt I will ever take this drug again. At least dosed like it was prescribed to me.  And I am not prone to yeast infections.  Just terrible.

column2: mama, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: none

column2: India, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Started this medication on Monday and by Thursday the infection was gone. Prescibed 500mg 2x a day for 5 days-only side effect was metal taste in the mouth.

column2: MissFox, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took it twice a day for 7 days. Seems to have cleared the BV up. Left a yeast infection like no other, but a hydrogen peroxide/water douche-out helped until I could take the medication prescribed for that. The metallic taste in the mouth is kinda annoying, but MUCH better and more effective, and BY FAR easier to swallow than the Flagyl I took often before that (as my case had been recurrent thus far).  For some reason, Tindamax made me hyper too.  I would recommend this to people who have had this condition.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After my last dose of Tindamax, I was rushed to the E/R by ambulance and spent 4 days in the hospital.  My diagnosis was non-viral toxic hepatitis caused directly from taking this medication as directed by my doctor.

column2: CoCo, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: cured09, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Why are you taking this medication in such high dosages. I had BV and took 500mg 2x day for 7 days, never got sick and it went away completely. Your physicians are idiots!! Of course you were sick with such high dosages at one time!!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I think this medicine is effective. The only side affect I had from taking the medication was the funny taste in my mouth, a little nausea, and shortly following the dosage, I had a yeast infection

column2: sam, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given a sample of 2 pills @ 500 mg to treat any bacteria that might appear as a result of a removal of an iud.  I was feverish, chilled and nauseaous.  I have never had a reaction to any medicine before.  I wouldnt recommend this medicine at all.

column9: I still am having the , I call it rash in the groin area and into the vagina and under my stomach. I took 1 weeks perscription and I still have the red rash under the stomach, the rest is a light color brown.

column2: maryann, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medicine in pill form for 5 days and I still have a part that is like raw meat.

column2: maryann, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My OB-GYN   gave me tindamax 500mg tablets for some kind of fungus I have in the groin area and under my stomach. After using two different kind of creams was told to stop them as it was before Xmas. Not much better at all and my script is finished today.

column2: blessed, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: First dose (4pills) was ok.Second dose (4pills)was ok at first, just left a horrible taste in my mouth. However the next day I was nauseous, vomiting and just felt absolutely awful. A week later I still feel worn out. I am fatigued  and have no appetite. However it seems to have cleared up the vaginosis.

column2: zem, 55-64 Female  (Patient)
David, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Felt a whole lot better while taking this medication. Just finished the course and am waiting to see if the diarahhea has stopped and how things will be. It gave me a lot of my memory and stamina back and my mental state generally improved.

column2: Invida, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed a dosage of four tablets of 500 mg twice a day. The medication left a terrible taste in my mouth for four days. No matter how many times I brushed my teeth or rinsed out my mouth, it would not go away. I found it really unpleasant. I'm hoping not to have to take it again for this reason, but it seems to have been effective so far.

column2: RN/patient, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This drug is equally as effective as Flagyl for treating BV, but fewer side effects.  There was a slight metalic taste for a few hours after taking it, but that improved with each dose.  I had no other issues with this medication.

column2: macaroni,  Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: A one-time dose of 2,000 mg caused me to miss four days of my life--2 days of extreme chills, 3 days of fever up to 101, massive and constant headache, total body aches and pains, sporadic digital numbness, dry heaves, loss of appetite, joint and muscle pain.  I got tested for the flu, which I did not have. Not only did I have to pay for the initial appointment, but I had to go to FOUR other medical appointments in order to get relief from the SIDE EFFECTS.  I couldn't eat for four days, lost weight, became very weak and dizzy.  My husband had to miss work in order to care for me.      I was not feeling bad at all before the Tindamax. I have other issues with my health provider which I will deal with, but I will NEVER take Tindamax again and will do my best to tell other people about this journey into and out of Hell.

column2: Goody, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is my fifth month taking Tindamax.  I have Lyme disease and take it 1 week of every month plus doxycycline every day.  The tindamax brings on fatigue, achy joints but this time feeling feverish.
